trans-unit.source: Sets the window region of a window

seg-source.mrk: Sets the window region of a window

target.mrk: Sets the window region of a window

trans-unit.source: Handle to the window whose window region is to be set.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the window whose window region is to be set.

target.mrk: Handle to the window whose window region is to be set.

trans-unit.source: Handle to a region. The function sets the window region of the window to this region.

seg-source.mrk: The function sets the window region of the window to this region.

target.mrk: The function sets the window region of the window to this region.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether the system redraws the window after setting the window region.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether the system redraws the window after setting the window region.

target.mrk: Specifies whether the system redraws the window after setting the window region.

trans-unit.source: The window region determines the area within the window where the system permits drawing.

seg-source.mrk: The window region determines the area within the window where the system permits drawing.

target.mrk: The window region determines the area within the window where the system permits drawing.

trans-unit.source: The system does not display any portion of a window that lies outside of the window region

seg-source.mrk: The system does not display any portion of a window that lies outside of the window region

target.mrk: The system does not display any portion of a window that lies outside of the window region

trans-unit.source: When this function is called, the system sends the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING and WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED messages to the window.

seg-source.mrk: When this function is called, the system sends the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING and WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED messages to the window.

target.mrk: When this function is called, the system sends the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING and WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED messages to the window.

trans-unit.source: The coordinates of a window's window region are relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area of the window.

seg-source.mrk: The coordinates of a window's window region are relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area of the window.

target.mrk: The coordinates of a window's window region are relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area of the window.

trans-unit.source: After a successful call to SetWindowRgn, the system owns the region specified by the region handle $hRgn.

seg-source.mrk: After a successful call to SetWindowRgn, the system owns the region specified by the region handle $hRgn.

target.mrk: After a successful call to SetWindowRgn, the system owns the region specified by the region handle $hRgn.

trans-unit.source: The system does not make a copy of the region. Thus, you should not make any further function calls with this region handle.

seg-source.mrk: The system does not make a copy of the region.
Thus, you should not make any further function calls with this region handle.

target.mrk: The system does not make a copy of the region.
Thus, you should not make any further function calls with this region handle.

trans-unit.source: In particular, do not delete this region handle. The system deletes the region handle when it no longer needed.

seg-source.mrk: In particular, do not delete this region handle.
The system deletes the region handle when it no longer needed.

target.mrk: In particular, do not delete this region handle.
The system deletes the region handle when it no longer needed.

trans-unit.source: get height of window title and width of window frame - may be different when XP theme is ON/OFF

seg-source.mrk: get height of window title and width of window frame - may be different when XP theme is ON/OFF

target.mrk: get height of window title and width of window frame - may be different when XP theme is ON/OFF

trans-unit.source: get whole window size (no client size defined in GUICreate)

seg-source.mrk: get whole window size (no client size defined in GUICreate)

target.mrk: get whole window size (no client size defined in GUICreate)

trans-unit.source: make inner transparent area but add controls

seg-source.mrk: make inner transparent area but add controls

target.mrk: make inner transparent area but add controls

trans-unit.source: add control's area to given region

seg-source.mrk: add control's area to given region

target.mrk: add control's area to given region
